channel.title: How To PortFoward A NETGEAR Router
channel.description:
Tutorial: This is going to teach people how to PortFoward on a NETGEAR Router. I have a Netgear Router, connected to OPTUS. An Australian network.
Step 1. Open up internet explorer and write in 10.1.1.1 [img]http://file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Marguerite%20and%20James/Desktop/Photo%201.JPG[/img]
Step 2: Type in Username "Admin", without "", and password "Password", again without "". Unless you have changed it, that is what the info is.
Step 3: Go to "Services". and Press Add Custom Service.
Step 4: Enter your RSPS Port Number in Starting Port, and Finish Port. For Name just type in "RSPS", and leave it to TCP. Press Apply. [img]http://file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Marguerite%20and%20James/Desktop/Photo%202.JPG[/img]
Step 5: Go To "Firewall Rules", and where it says "Outbound Services", press Add.
Step 6. For "Service", choose your RSPS one, and change "Action", to Allow Always. Then for "Log", just change it to "Never", for less lag. Then press "Apply". [img]http://file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Marguerite%20and%20James/Desktop/Photo%203.JPG[/img]
Step 7. Now go to Inbound Services, and press "Add".
Step 8: Find out your COMPUTER I.P., by going to Start, Run, cmd. Then type "ipconfig", without "". Write down the number next to "I.P. Address".
Step 9. Go back to the internet, and for "Service", choose the RSPS one, for Action, Allow Always. Then for "Send To LAN Server", type in your I.P. Then for "WAN Users", leave it to Any. Then for "Log", do "never", for less lag. Then, press Apply [img]http://file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Marguerite%20and%20James/Desktop/Photo%204.JPG[/img]
Step 10. Now Press Apply. Now quit out of Internet Explorer, and you are done.
THAT IS A COMPLETE, EASY TUTORIAL ON HOW TO PORTFOWARD FOR A NETGEAR ROUTER, IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, ASK ME. PLZ REP ME!!
PLEASE NOTE, I TRIED ADDING PHOTOS, BUT I DON'T KNOW HOW TOO ON MOPARSCAPE.COM, IF YOU CAN, PLEASE TELL ME HOW!!

item.title: How To PortFoward A NETGEAR Router
item.dc:creator: @iBuffo iBuffo
item.description:
@iBuffo wrote:

Tutorial: This is going to teach people how to PortFoward on a NETGEAR Router. I have a Netgear Router, connected to OPTUS. An Australian network.

Step 1. Open up internet explorer and write in 10.1.1.1

Step 2: Type in Username “Admin”, without “”, and password “Password”, again without “”. Unless you have changed it, that is what the info is.

Step 3: Go to “Services”. and Press Add Custom Service.

Step 4: Enter your RSPS Port Number in Starting Port, and Finish Port. For Name just type in “RSPS”, and leave it to TCP. Press Apply.

Step 5: Go To “Firewall Rules”, and where it says “Outbound Services”, press Add.

Step 6. For “Service”, choose your RSPS one, and change “Action”, to Allow Always. Then for “Log”, just change it to “Never”, for less lag. Then press “Apply”.

Step 7. Now go to Inbound Services, and press “Add”.

Step 8: Find out your COMPUTER I.P., by going to Start, Run, cmd. Then type “ipconfig”, without “”. Write down the number next to “I.P. Address”.

Step 9. Go back to the internet, and for “Service”, choose the RSPS one, for Action, Allow Always. Then for “Send To LAN Server”, type in your I.P. Then for “WAN Users”, leave it to Any. Then for “Log”, do “never”, for less lag. Then, press Apply

Step 10. Now Press Apply. Now quit out of Internet Explorer, and you are done.

THAT IS A COMPLETE, EASY TUTORIAL ON HOW TO PORTFOWARD FOR A NETGEAR ROUTER, IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, ASK ME. PLZ REP ME!!

PLEASE NOTE, I TRIED ADDING PHOTOS, BUT I DON’T KNOW HOW TOO ON MOPARSCAPE.COM, IF YOU CAN, PLEASE TELL ME HOW!!

Read full topic
item.source: How To PortFoward A NETGEAR Router
